info.title: ReliefWeb
info.description: ReliefWeb is a humanitarian information service provided by the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA). Our editors select, classify, curate and deliver the content that is most relevant to global humanitarian workers and decision-makers on a 24/7 basis, enabling them to make informed decisions and to plan effective response.

tags.name: Reports
tags.description: Gateway to updates and analysis from more than 4,000 global information sources.

get.summary: List or search updates, headlines or maps
get.description: Retrieve a list of reports. Reports are updates and analysis curated from more than 4,000 sources and tagged by our team of editors working around the clock.

get.summary: List or search humanitarian job offers
get.description: Retrieve a list of job offers.
Retrieve a list of humanitarian learning opportunities. Training opportunities and courses for useful and necessary humanitarian skills.

parameters.description: The identifier of the training opportunity.
parameters.name: trainingId

get.summary: List or search organizations providing content to ReliefWeb

theme.description: Category of information contained in the report.

limit-post.description: The maximum number of items to return for a list query. The default is 10 and the maximum 1000.

offset-post.description: The offset from which to return the items in a list query. Allows paging through all results. The default is 0.

preset-post.description: Pre-built standard configurations of queries, filters and sorts for common use cases.

query-value-post.description: Specify the terms of your fuzzy search. The default is no query.

query-operator-post.description: Specify the operator by which your search query words will be combined.

query-fields-post.description: Specify which fields to target with your search. You may use boost syntax here, see the Advanced API Usage documentation.

fields-include-post.description: Fields to include for each item.

fields-exclude-post.description: Sub-fields to exclude from results. For example, if you include date you may exclude date.changed.

filter-field-post.description: Field to filter by. Every condition must contain either a field or conditions property.

filter-value-post.description: Value for the field being filtered. Leave blank to require existence of the field, must be present for range and value conditions.

filter-operator-post.description: Operator by which filters will be combined.

filter-negate-post.description: Reverse the filter to include those items that do not match.

filter-conditions-post.description: This property is used to combine conditions with a logical connector (the operator property). Every condition must contain one of the field or conditions properties.

facets-field-post.description: Field to facet by. May include dates, references or the status field.

facets-name-post.description: Identifier for resulting facet data. Useful when faceting multiple ways on the same field.

facets-limit-post.description: Limit the number of facets returned for non-date based facets.

facets-sort-post.description: The sort order of non-date facets. Sorting may be by value or count of terms, and ascending or descending. count defaults to desc, value defaults to asc.

facets-filter-post.description: Apply all the same capabilities of the filter parameter to the specific results of this facet request.

facets-interval-post.description: Round date information to the nearest interval unit. Apply all the same capabilities of the filter parameter to the specific results of this facet request.

sort-post.description: Sort the list results. Defaults to search relevance. Values in the form of field name: asc|desc.
